author: Ranger Rick
title: Redwood Trail & campground map feedback
description_html:
I had a chance to test out the new map for the Redwood Trail this weekend. Wanted to share a few thoughts:

  • Clarity: The new legend is much easier to understand. The symbols are intuitive!

  • Route Colors: Love the color-coding for difficulty levels. It's a great quick reference for visitors.

  • Material: The waterproof material is a game-changer, especially in unpredictable weather.

Perhaps we could add a few more landmarks for better orientation. Overall, it's a fantastic update!

comments.body_html: Thanks for the feedback! I'll make sure to pass this along to the design team.
I agree, the new map is a huge improvement. I'm glad to see the team is taking visitor feedback into account!

author: Cliff Rockwell
title: Old Pine Tavern this Friday ğŸ»ğŸ•
description_html: For anyone interested in unwinding after a busy week on the trailsâ€¦ we're planning a casual get-together at The Old Pine Tavern this Friday. Feel free to join in and bring along any fun tales from the park. Hope to see y'all there!

comments.body_html: I'm only coming if Rick promises to sing karaoke again.

replies.body_html: Hopefully I'll still have a voice after this one ğŸ˜…

comments.body_html: I'll be a little late, I have to pick up my daughter from soccer practice first.

author: Daisy Meadows
title: April Book Club Selection
description_html:
Alright folks, it's that time again to pick our next adventure in pages! Here are the options we collected at last week's staff meeting.

What are we feeling for this month's book club selection?

author: Autumn Hayes
title: Hiking club this Saturday
description_html: Who's in for Hiking Club this Saturday? Weather is looking beautiful! Meet at the park at 8am?

author: Reed Marsh
title: Overheard on the trail
description_html: I overheard a kid telling his friend on the trail today, "If we see a bear, we just have to run faster than the slowest hiker, right?" Made me chuckle.

author: Willow Carter
title: Spring grant opportunities
description_html:
As we head into the new season, a set of opportunities are on the horizon. Here's a quick rundown of grants that might be of interest to us:

  • National Conservation Grant: Supports efforts in preserving natural habitats. Deadline: April 15.

  • Youth Engagement Fund: Aids in projects that engage young people with nature. Deadline: May 1.

  • Historical Preservation Grant: For the restoration of historical landmarks within our parks. Deadline: April 30.

  • Eco-Innovation Award: Offers funding for sustainable technology integration. Deadline: May 15.

Please consider which of these grants align with your current projects and prepare to discuss potential applications in our next meeting. Message myself or Ranger Rick if you'd like to discuss anything 1-on-1.

More info: https://www.nps.gov/history/grants.htm

author: Misty Vale
title: Campsite #4 water fountain
description_html: We've received reports of the water fountain at Campsite #4 malfunctioningâ€”it's not dispensing water. I've flagged this as a priority for the maintenance team. Maintenance, please update once this has been addressed. Thanks!

author: Hunter Cooper
title: New hiking boots
description_html: Found a pair of these on sale this weekend, excited to take them on the trails soon! https://www.backcountry.com/salomon-x-ultra-4-mid-gtx-hiking-shoe-mens

author: Reed Marsh
title: Help needed: clearing the fallen tree on Oak Trail
description_html: I'm reaching out for assistance with the large oak that's come down on the Oak Trail. It's blocking a major path and we need to clear it before this weekend's influx of visitors. If anyone can spare some time tomorrow morning for the removal, it would greatly help expedite the process. We're coordinating efforts at 8 AM by the trailhead. Any help is appreciated to ensure visitor safety and trail accessibility. Thanks in advance!

author: Brooke Rivers
title: Reed Marsh: Wildflower Meadow signage repair
description_html: Reed Marsh deserves a big shout-out for the swift repair of the broken signage at Wildflower Meadow! His dedication ensured that visitors were quickly rerouted to avoid confusion and maintain the safety of our beautiful trails. Great job, Reed, for keeping Frontier Forest welcoming and accessible!

author: Ranger Rick
title: Cliffside Trail inspection
description_html:
Walked the Cliffside Trail for our routine inspection and noted some erosion near the midpoint lookout. The trail markers are still visible, but we should schedule maintenance to shore up the path.

Also, I spotted a pair of eagles nesting in the old pine by the east bend. Let's keep an eye on that area to minimize disturbances during their nesting period. ğŸ¦…

author: Sierra Peaks
title: Wildflower Meadow trailhead signage
description_html: A guest reported broken signage at the Wildflower Meadow trailhead. It appears to be weather-related damage. I'm heading out to assess the situation and will update on the repair timeline. If anyone has noticed other signs in the area that need attention, please let me know so we can address all issues in one go.

comments.body_html: Thanks Misty, I'll join you as soon as I get to the park.

author: Reed Marsh
title: Must-have gear items for first-time campers
description_html: I thought this guide was pretty good. https://koa.com/blog/must-have-gear-items-for-first-time-campers/

comments.body_html: Thanks for sharing, Reed! I like this one too: https://www.rei.com/learn/expert-advice/family-camping-checklist.html

author: Ranger Rick
title: Redwood Trail morning patrol
description_html: Just got back from the morning patrol on Redwood Trail. The recent rains have left some patches muddy, especially near the creek crossings. Hikers should be advised to wear appropriate footwear and expect slower paces. The overhead canopy offers some shelter, but sporadic drizzle is still coming through in places. No major obstructions or downed trees to report. Visibility is good, and the trail markers are all intact.

author: Misty Vale
title: Restocking First Aid Kits at Visitor Centers
description_html:
I've noticed that several first aid kits at our visitor centers are running low on supplies. To ensure the safety of our staff and visitors, we need to restock them ASAP. Here's what's needed:

  • Band-Aids of various sizes
  • Antiseptic wipes
  • Gauze pads
  • Medical tape
  • Disposable gloves

If anyone has noticed other items that are missing, please add to this list. Thanks!
